STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 14, 2024
Alison Anne Morrison
SHIAWASSEE COUNTY DHHS
1720 E M 21,
OWOSSO, MI, 48867-9054
RE: License#: CP780201406
Dear Alison Anne Morrison:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/11/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The CAP
was for the interim evaluation completed 11/9/2023. Areas identified in
noncompliance were Rule 503-3 and Rule 510-2. The CAP for these areas of
noncompliance was approved 11/9/2023 by DCWL. Neither of these areas were
identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reported the agency continued to complete
monthly CAP review meetings to ensure the agency's compliance with the

approved CAP. The agency also continues to utilize the checklists and other
documentation forms to maintain compliance with the approved CAP.
Financial Overview
Not Applicable
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not report any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: Relative caregiver was not at home/available at the time of the
scheduled visit. Child wellness confirmation could not be determined.
Resolution: Agency worker completed a home visit to determine/establish welfare of
the youth.
Corrective Action Plan approved 8/23/2024 by DCWL.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
10/11/2024
